text.p: Following are the main stories in Monday's Malaysian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- The Human Resources Ministry proposes to reward long-serving government and private sector employees with long-term benefits, including educational aid for their children.
-- The Public Service Department, which has given out millions of ringgit in loans to government servants and students, will work closely with the Inland Revenue Board to track down defaulters.
-- Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad says Malaysia and Kuwait need to re-establish air links and develop new sea links if two-way trade is to grow to a more profitable level.
-- Mahathir urges Kuwaiti businessmen to exploit Malaysia's strategic location to increase their presence in the Southeast Asian region.

-- Companies affected by the power breakdown in Peninsular Malaysia eight months ago appear to have regained confidence in the country's power infrastructure as well as in state power firm Tenaga Nasional Bhd, according to a survey.
